name: angular-component-editor
description: open all files of an angular component with a simple shortcut!

commands.title: Angular Component Editor: Open in Split View

angular-component-editor.enable.template.description: Whether the template file should be included when split viewing the component files

angular-component-editor.enable.script.description: Whether the script file should be included when split viewing the component files

angular-component-editor.enable.style.description: Whether the stylesheet file should be included when split viewing the component files

angular-component-editor.enable.spec.description: Whether the spec file should be included when split viewing the component files

angular-component-editor.files.template.description: The list of file extensions to try and open for the component template (checks in order)

angular-component-editor.files.script.description: The list of file extensions to try and open for the component script (checks in order)

angular-component-editor.files.style.description: The list of file extensions to try and open for the component stylesheet (checks in order)

angular-component-editor.files.spec.description: The list of file extensions to try and open for the component specification (checks in order)

angular-component-editor.locations.templ.description: In which tab the file should be opended (available options: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ViewColumn)

angular-component-editor.locations.scrip.description: In which tab the file should be opended (available options: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ViewColumn)

angular-component-editor.locations.style.description: In which tab the file should be opended (available options: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ViewColumn)

angular-component-editor.locations.spec.description: In which tab the file should be opended (available options: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ViewColumn)

scripts.pretest: npm run test-compile && npm run lint
